edu.cpp.cs.cs141.gp

Class UserInterface

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.gp.UserInterface
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class UserInterface
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class represents a user interface for the user to access it consist of all them menu, the introduction, and what should be displayed.
    See Also:

    • Field Detail

      • isDebugMode

        private boolean isDebugMode
        This field represents the state of the map, if the objects on the map are visible or not to the user. Its default value is set to false, and it can changed through isDebugMode.

      • canSeeBriefcase

        private boolean canSeeBriefcase
        This field represents the state of the briefcase and if it is visible to the user, it's true, and it can be changed through canSeeBriefcase.

      • invalidInput

        private boolean invalidInput
        This field checks to see if the input entered is valid. Its default is generally started as true, and it is switched to false when the user inputs a value, used to terminate input request loops. It is used in displayGameMenu(), setDifficulty(), selectAction(boolean), and selectDirection().

      • badInputStr

        private java.lang.String badInputStr
        This field is for when the input isn't valid. It is used in displayGameMenu(), setDifficulty(), selectAction(boolean), and selectDirection().

      • sc

        private java.util.Scanner sc

    • Constructor Detail

      • UserInterface

        public UserInterface()
        This constructor sets the default values of isDebugMode and canSeeBriefcase.

    • Method Detail

      • displayGameMenu

        public int displayGameMenu()
        This method is created to display the game menu, returning an integer value which will be plugged inside the setUp constructor inside the GameEngine class, giving a short welcome text, and allowing the user to select a new game or to load the previous game. This method sets invalidInput to true and while it is true, it loops. It catches poor inputs and displays badInputStr.
        Returns:
        input

      • setDifficulty

        public boolean setDifficulty()
        this method prints and asks the user if he wants to play on hard difficulty or not by asking for input using sc. If yes it plugs it into the setUp from the GameEngine. If the user input does not meet the criteria, it uses badInputStr to print that user hasn't entered the valid input. The field invalidInput is set to true, and while it is true, it runs.
        Returns:
        returnValue

      • selectAction

        public int selectAction(boolean outerMenu)
        this method takes in the boolean @param outerMenu which when set to true, displays the outerMenu which prints the options for the player to move, shoot, look, check Stats, debug, save, or quit, and asks for the user input for which option the user wants to pick, and if the isDebugMode is true, it will display the extra option to display the key. If the input is wrong, it prints badInputStr. This field uses invalidInput and is set to true to run.

      • changeDebug

        public void changeDebug()
        this method toggles the value of isDebugMode, which affects the darkness's display.

      • viewKey

        public void viewKey()
        this method displays the key to user, explaining what the characters stand for inside the map

      • selectDirection

        public int selectDirection()
        In this method, invalidInput is set to true, it runs, displaying the options for choosing direction and @return int value which is plug into the game engine

      • displayMap

        public void displayMap(int[][] mapPositions,
                       boolean[][] mapVision)
        This constructor takes all the positions of the map, room, player, and enemy from the GameEngine and prints it for the user to see. If #isDebugMod is false, the darkness (lack of vision) is displayed as [*], except for the player, rooms, and adjacent squares. If it is true, there is no darkness, and everything is visible.
        Parameters:
        mapPositions -
        mapVision -
